wiki.summary: Arcade Fire Songs can be triggered by a simple act. According to The Suburbs Songfacts, frontman Win Butler was sent a photograph of an old school friend of his, who was standing with his daughter sitting on his shoulders "at the mall around the corner from where we lived". He added: “The combination of seeing this familiar place and seeing my friend with his child brought back a lot of feeling from that time. I found myself trying to remember the town that we grew up in and trying to retrace as much as I could remember.”

track.name: The Suburbs
comments: all the houses built in the seventies finally fall...
if you get a chance to see this band...please do...they're brilliant live :)
this song is the truth. if my heart could sing, it would sing this song.
sometimes i can't believe it... i'm moving past the feeling and into the night.
beautiful song. never gets old. my favorite from arcade fire. what a terrific band. i would LOVE to hear and see this performed live.
Sooner or later we all sprawl down.
Every time I listen to this song. I get a warm fuzzy feeling that I don't get on most songs.
imo one of the quite many good tracks on the album:) "suburban war", "rococo", "ready to start", "half light II", "sprawl II".. difficult to pick one
I must have slept on this song when I first heard it, as it really didn't impress me. Second time around, wow, what was I thinking? Amazing song.
Sometimes I can't believe it. I'm moving past the feeling again.
Sometimes I can't believe it. I'm moving past the feeling again. The kids want to be so hard
Sometimes I can't believe it/I'm movin' past the feeling - a couplet well worth repeating
